bibliography:
Alston, William P., 1991, Perceiving God: The Epistemology of
Religious Experience, Ithaca: Cornell University Press.

Barrett, Justin L., 2004, Why would anyone believe in
God?, Lanham: AltaMira.

Braine, David, 1988, The Reality of Time and the Existence of
God: The Project of Proving God’s Existence, Oxford: Clarendon
Press.

Braithwaite, Richard B., 1955, An Empiricist’s View of the

Press.

F. Pollock (ed.), London: Macmillan.

The Good News’,  Philosophical
Review , 116: 187–217.

Christensen, David and Lackey (eds.), Jennifer, 2013, The

University Press.

Craig, William Lane, 1979, The Kalam Cosmological
Argument, London: Macmillan

Cambridge University Press.

Feldman, Richard, 2007, ‘Reasonable Religious

University Press.

Feldman, Richard and Ted Warfield (eds.),
2011, Disagreement, Oxford: Oxford University Press.

Forrest, Peter, 1996, God without the Supernatural: A Defense

Geivett, R.D., and B. Sweetman, 1992, Contemporary

Katz, Steven, 1978, “Language Epistemology and

Kelly, Thomas, 2005, ‘The Epistemic Significance of

Kraft, James, 2007, ‘Religious disagreement, externalism,

Malcolm, Norman, 1992, “The Groundlessness of

Mavrodes, George I., 1988, Revelation in Religious

Miller, Barry, 1991, From Existence to God : A Contemporary

Mitchell, Basil, 1973, The Justification of Religious

–––, 1990, ‘Newman as a Philosopher,’

Plantinga, Alvin, 1983, ‘Reason and Belief in God,’

–––, 2000, Warranted Christian Belief,

Schellenberg, John, 2009, The will to imagine: a
